definition: (idiom) thought-provoking/to give one food for thought
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: The cartoon reveals a very thought-provoking scene.
sentences.chinese: 这幅图刻画一个非常发人深思的情景。

sentences.english: A contentious past argues for a provocative future.
sentences.chinese: 一个引发争议的过去促成发人深思的未来。

sentences.english: Dad, you have just worded a profound change in my personality.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸，你刚才这番话发人深思，使我幡然醒悟。

definition: variant of 發人深省|发人深省[fa1 ren2 shen1 xing3]
thought-provoking/worth thinking over/to provide food for thought
to have profound import (idiom); to be deeply significant
the implied message is deep (idiom); having deep implications
simple words with a profound meaning (idiom)
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
to hit home on the evils of the day (idiom); fig. to hit a current political target/to hit the nub of the matter
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
to hit the target and do real damage (idiom)/fig. to hit where it hurts/fig. to hit home/an argument that hits the nail on the head
